data.title: UN chief slams ‘cruelest phase’ of Gaza conflict
data.description: UNITED NATIONS: Uni­t­ed Nations chief Antonio Guterres on Friday said “Palestinians in Gaza are enduring what may be the cruelest phase of this cruel conflict” as Israel ramps up its military offensive. “For nearly 80 days, Israel blocked the entry of life-saving international aid,” he said in a statement. “The entire population of Gaza is facing the risk of famine. “The Israeli military offensive is intensifying with atrocious levels of death and destruction. “Today, 80 per cent of Gaza has been either designated an Israeli-militarised zone or an area where people have been ordered to leave.” More than 50 Palestinians dead or missing in Israeli strike on Jabalia Aid also began trickling into the Gaza Strip on Monday for the first time in more than two months, amid condemnation of the Israeli blockade that sparked severe shortages of food and medicine. “Israel has clear obligations under international humanitarian law,” Guterres said. “As the occupying power, it must agree to allow and facilitate the aid that is needed,” he said. More than 50 Palestinians were killed or went missing after an Israeli air strike on a residential building in the Jabalia al-Balad area of northern Gaza, Palestinian Civil Defence sources say. Israeli drones targeted more than five locations near the entrance to Deir al-Balah in central Gaza on Friday morning, the official Palestinian news agency Wafa reported. When people rushed to help the victims, Israeli forces attacked them again, injuring several more Palestinians. Separately, three people, including a young girl, lost their lives in an Israeli airstrike on an apartment near Abdel Aal junction on al-Jalaa Street in Gaza City. Two siblings were killed, and their father suffered critical injuries when an Israeli strike hit a home in the western camp area of Khan Yunis in southern Gaza. In eastern Khan Yunis, several casualties are reported after Israeli forces struck a home in the town of Abasan al-Kabira. Israeli air strikes also killed at least six Palestinians guarding aid trucks against looters, Hamas officials said, underlining the problems hindering supplies from reaching hungry people in Gaza following Israel’s 11-week-long blockade. The Israeli military claimed 107 trucks carrying flour and other foodstuffs as well as medical supplies, entered the Gaza Strip from the Kerem Shalom crossing point on Thursday. But getting the supplies to people sheltering in tents and other makeshift accommodations has been fitful. So far, an umbrella network of Palestinian aid groups said, 119 aid trucks have entered Gaza since Israel eased its blockade on Monday in the face of an international outcry. But distribution has been hampered by looting by groups of men, some of them armed, near the city of Khan Yunis, the network said. A Hamas official said six members of a security team tasked with guarding the shipments were killed. There was no immediate comment from the Israeli military. The aid groups network also said the amount of aid coming into Gaza was still inadequate and only included a narrow range of supplies. It said Israel’s agreement to allow trucks to enter the war-shattered enclave was a “deceptive manoeuvre” to avoid international pressure calling for the lifting of the blockade. Published in Dawn, May 24th, 2025

data.title: Budget put off to June 10 as talks with IMF continue
data.description: • Decision follows inconclusive discussions with lender, to avoid conflict with Eid holidays • IMF spokesperson rejects Indian claims regarding misuse of funds by Pakistan • President meets IMF delegation, praises it for supporting Islamabad’s economic stability ISLAMABAD: The government on Friday postponed the announcement of the federal budget 2025-26 by more than a week to June 10 amid inconclusive discussions with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on some of the critical fiscal measures and to avoid the Eid break during the budget session. Informed sources said the visiting IMF staff mission had multiple rounds of discussion on Friday, including a wrap-up session with Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb. The minister’s adviser, Khurram Schehzad, confirmed that the federal budget for the next year will be presented on June 10, and the Pakistan Economic Survey 2024-25 will be released on June 9. Earlier, the budget announcement was set for June 2. Planning Minister Ahsan Iqbal told Dawn that discussions with the IMF had just concluded, and it was thought that the budget announcement should be made soon after Eid holidays to ensure continuity of the budget session. Sources said there was also a view that it would be difficult for the government to recollect a sufficient number of members of parliament from their hometowns for the budget debate if the budget was announced before Eid which is likely to fall on June 7. Therefore, the budget announcement would be immediately followed by a comprehensive debate in the house and enable standing committees on finance to read through budget proposals and give their input before its passage by the two houses, well before June 30. Also, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif was leaving for a whirlwind visit to Turkiye, Azerbaijan, Iran, and some other friendly countries in Central Asia and the Middle East, and would be unable to personally indulge in budgetary settings. He would be back from abroad on May 29. As a consequence, the meeting of the Annual Plan Coordination Committee (APCC) for finalisation of federal and provincial development plans set for Monday (May 26) has also been postponed to a fresh date to be set later. Sources said the recent sudden announcement of national tariff policy envisaging a drastic cut in customs tariffs from 19 to 9.5 per cent on raw materials and semi-finished items for a few industries, besides the removal of additional customs duties, had also created a lot of concern among the relevant industrial sector. The five-year tariff policy approved for inclusion in budget inclusion in the budget this year by the prime minister himself compelled the powerful industries to launch a counter campaign. Coupled with this, the defence allocations for next year had a reasonable budgetary impact, which could not be settled with the IMF staff before the wrap-up meeting with the finance minister, although discussions between FBR’s top brass and the staff mission continued until evening. Sources said the engagements with the IMF would now continue virtually over the next week till finalisation of the defence budget, and as a result, the revenue side of the equation and other estimates under the budget, including the federal public sector development programme that was now estimated at Rs1tr. Staff-level discussions on the next budget began on May 14. Sources said there is no plan the to increase the rate of petroleum levy in the near future, except for a separate imposition of carbon levy on a number of items, starting with about Rs3 per litre and going up to Rs5 in second year to meet a requirement of Climate Resilience Support Fund (RSF). The sources said the relief measures for the salaried class , real estate, and expenditure control measures had been discussed with the IMF staff, but this would remain subject to an alternative resource envelope to be presented by the authorities, as fiscal consolidation would remain one of the central themes of the next year’s budget. India’s objections As the talks with IMF staff concluded, the Fund’s spokesperson at its headquarters in Washington rubbished Indian concerns about recent approval by its executive board of $1.4bn in additional RSF support besides disbursement of $1bn second tranche of the $7bn Extended Fund Facility (EFF). “The [IMF executive] board approved the disbursement after finding that Pakistan had met all performance targets and made progress on structural reforms”, said IMF spokesperson Julie Kozack at a regular news briefing , adding that the loan programme for Islamabad was only for stabilisation of foreign exchange reserves and not related to the budget financing. An Indian journalist asked the spokesperson about the recent bailout package by the IMF to Pakistan, saying “the Indian government has expressed a lot of displeasure with Pakistan planning to use this package to build — rebuild — areas that allegedly support cross-border terrorism.” Another journalist asked about the implications of the escalation between Pakistan and India on both economies, while another questioned what “safeguards the IMF has that its funds won’t be used for military or in support of military actions.”. In response to the questions, Ms Kozack said the IMF’s Executive Board approved Pakistan’s EFF programme in September of 2024. “The first review at that time was planned for the first quarter of 2025. And consistent with that timeline, on March 25, 2025, the IMF Staff and the Pakistani authorities reached a staff-level agreement on the first review for the EFF,” she said. She added that the agreement was then presented to the IMF’s executive board, which completed the review on May 9. “As a result of the completion of that review, Pakistan received the disbursement at that time,” she said. Ms Kozack explained that the global money lender had a standard procedure in place under its programmes, which allowed its executive board to conduct periodic reviews of lending programs to assess countries’ progress. The board, she said, particularly looked at whether the programme was on track, whether the conditions under the programme were met, and whether any policy changes were needed to bring the programme back on track. She then said that Pakistan’s programme was approved after the country successfully met all of the required targets. Regarding the question on safeguards, she clarified that IMF financing was provided to members for the purpose of resolving balance of payments problems, therefore, in the case of Pakistan, all the disbursements received under the EFF were allocated to the reserves of the central bank. “So, those disbursements are at the central bank, and under the programme, those resources are not part of budget financing. They are not transferred to the government to support the budget,” she said. Zardari meets IMF delegation President Asif Ali Zardari on Friday said that the IMF programme had played a supportive role in stabilising Pakistan’s economy, according to the APP . President Asif Ali Zardari meets with an IMF delegation led by Jihad Azour at President House on May 23, 2025. — PID The president, in a meeting with an IMF delegation led by the director of the Middle East and Central Asia Department, Jihad Azour, highlighted the lender’s positive role in promoting economic development in developing nations. He also acknowledged and appreciated the IMF’s contribution to Pakistan’s economic progress. The delegation expressed satisfaction over Pakistan’s efforts for economic reforms and implementation of the IMF programme, which they observed was progressing in the right direction. Mr Zardari thanked the IMF for its support and cooperation with Pakistan and also appreciated the finance ministry for its efforts to improve the national economy. Published in Dawn, May 24th, 2025

data.title: March of folly
data.description: BEYOND the wave of triumphalism and jingoism prevailing in Pakistan and India after the recent military confrontation, cooler and saner thinking must prevail in the subcontinent. Both countries were far higher on the ‘escalation ladder’ in the recent episode than many people realise, with previously established red lines and thresholds having been crossed by both sides in a matter of hours. To make matters worse, the Indian political leadership, having boxed itself in a narrowing space self-created by electoral expediency and hyper-nationalism, has lowered the threshold of all-out war in the face of its perceived humiliation. The events that have led us to this ‘new normal’ of living under an even darker shadow of nuclear war mirror the march of folly witnessed so many times in history, and captured by Pulitzer Prize-winning American historian Barbara W. Tuchman in her book of the same name. Her bottom-line? On too many occasions, states have acted contrary to their long-run self-interest. India’s current government is pushing the country in that direction. How did we get here? In the most recent iteration, that is. The terror attack committed in Pahalgam by a shadowy, previously unheard of ‘resistance’ group had all the markings of an atrocity meant to inflame sectarian passions and provoke conflict. Pakistan’s response was both reasoned as well as reasonable. It called for an independent international investigation into the incident. The Indian political leadership under BJP, on the other hand, had already primed itself for upping the ante, including launching a military strike on its nuclear-armed neighbour. As part of a wider political strategy, Prime Minister Modi’s default mode with regards to attribution for any terror attack is the presumption of Pakistan’s guilt, without the need for an impartial investigation or evidence. In stark contrast to Pakistan, where India-centred jingoism has no traction as an election strategy of mainstream political parties, an appeal to hyper-nationalism and religious fanaticism provides a winning platform in India, and has been cynically exploited by BJP. South Asia needs peace, not another doctrine that further lowers the threshold of all-out war. It is important to note that creating a bogeyman, an imaginary external threat or the fear of ‘the other’, has been a widely used tactic by demagogues throughout history to justify undermining democracy at home and solidify a slide into authoritarianism. India’s response to Pahalgam is fraught with strategic miscalculation borne out of hubris. It mistakenly thought a fragile economy and frayed internal cohesion would limit Pakistan’s ability to effectively strike back. It also overestimated its own operational capabilities on the military side, as also its diplomatic standing and ability to rally the international community to ‘punish’ Pakistan. In doing so, Mr Modi has unleashed a dangerous escalatory dynamic, leading to an unstable equilibrium between the two countries: neither fully a cold war nor a hot peace, but a strategic pregnant pause between intensifying conflicts. Ironically, India stands to lose much more than Pakistan from its bizarre strategic calculus. The first casualty is India’s carefully crafted narrative with regards to Pakistan and the disputed Kashmir region. Over the years, India had managed with varying success to ‘de-hyphenate’ itself from Pakistan, project Kashmir as a bilateral dispute, paint Pakistan as a sponsor of non-state proxies involved in cross-border terrorist activities, and isolate Pakistan diplomatically. By providing Pakistan with a permanent casus belli via suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty and working aggressively to dam the Indus basin waters that flow into the lower riparian, as well as by lowering the threshold of all-out war between the two nuclear-armed neighbours, India has all but ensured abiding international attention to, and eventual mediation in, the Kashmir dispute. Expecting that the rest of the world will ignore the danger of nuclear war caused by India’s escalatory and irresponsible actions is evidence of how disconnected its political leadership has become from ground realities. Apart from the diplomatic setback, equally damaging for India, or perhaps even more so, is the permanent harm Mr Modi’s political strategy is likely to inflict on India’s economy. While the Indian economy has not been exactly shining under Mr Modi, in large part causing the electoral setback BJP faced in the 2024 general elections and leading to the desperate beating of war drums witnessed recently, it is still well-positioned to gain substantially from the partial decoupling underway between the US and China. Along with Southeast Asia’s economic powerhouses such as Vietnam and Indonesia, India can potentially host supply chains for many of the advanced economies’ manufacturers that have been uprooted from China, or are planning to migrate. This opportunity to attract foreign investment is potentially worth anywhere between $500 billion to $1 trillion in the medium term in my estimate, and is there either for the taking, or for squandering. While India has begun to attract significant inflows of foreign direct investment over the past few years, inward FDI into India is still almost one-sixth of the foreign investment flows into mainland China — at $28bn in 2023 versus $163bn. The stock of FDI in India is an even lower fraction in comparison to mainland China. Before India fashions an even more reflexive strategy that brings the two quarrelling South Asian neighbours closer to the edge, it should draw lessons from 2002. Months of full-scale mobilisation of the two armies and a tense stand-off along the border led to foreign nationals, many working in India’s IT hubs of Bangalore and Chennai, fleeing in droves on specially chartered flights. With the lengthening shadow of nuclear Armageddon on the subcontinent, it will be moot if many choose to return in the next round. With so much at stake, India stands to lose big if it pursues its current path of confrontation. Instead of striving to become an economic growth node for the subcontinent, peacefully coexisting and trading with its neighbours, cooperating regionally to lift millions of South Asians out of poverty and illiteracy, and by becoming a beacon of a genuine inclusive democracy, the current Indian political leadership has chosen a very different path. History will not be kind. The writer has been a member of several past economic advisory councils under different prime ministers. Published in Dawn, May 24th, 2025
data.translatedTitle: March of folly
data.translatedDescription: BEYOND the wave of triumphalism and jingoism prevailing in Pakistan and India after the recent military confrontation, cooler and saner thinking must prevail in the subcontinent. Both countries were far higher on the ‘escalation ladder’ in the recent episode than many people realise, with previously established red lines and thresholds having been crossed by both sides in a matter of hours. To make matters worse, the Indian political leadership, having boxed itself in a narrowing space self-created by electoral expediency and hyper-nationalism, has lowered the threshold of all-out war in the face of its perceived humiliation. The events that have led us to this ‘new normal’ of living under an even darker shadow of nuclear war mirror the march of folly witnessed so many times in history, and captured by Pulitzer Prize-winning American historian Barbara W. Tuchman in her book of the same name. Her bottom-line? On too many occasions, states have acted contrary to their long-run self-interest. India’s current government is pushing the country in that direction. How did we get here? In the most recent iteration, that is. The terror attack committed in Pahalgam by a shadowy, previously unheard of ‘resistance’ group had all the markings of an atrocity meant to inflame sectarian passions and provoke conflict. Pakistan’s response was both reasoned as well as reasonable. It called for an independent international investigation into the incident. The Indian political leadership under BJP, on the other hand, had already primed itself for upping the ante, including launching a military strike on its nuclear-armed neighbour. As part of a wider political strategy, Prime Minister Modi’s default mode with regards to attribution for any terror attack is the presumption of Pakistan’s guilt, without the need for an impartial investigation or evidence. In stark contrast to Pakistan, where India-centred jingoism has no traction as an election strategy of mainstream political parties, an appeal to hyper-nationalism and religious fanaticism provides a winning platform in India, and has been cynically exploited by BJP. South Asia needs peace, not another doctrine that further lowers the threshold of all-out war. It is important to note that creating a bogeyman, an imaginary external threat or the fear of ‘the other’, has been a widely used tactic by demagogues throughout history to justify undermining democracy at home and solidify a slide into authoritarianism. India’s response to Pahalgam is fraught with strategic miscalculation borne out of hubris. It mistakenly thought a fragile economy and frayed internal cohesion would limit Pakistan’s ability to effectively strike back. It also overestimated its own operational capabilities on the military side, as also its diplomatic standing and ability to rally the international community to ‘punish’ Pakistan. In doing so, Mr Modi has unleashed a dangerous escalatory dynamic, leading to an unstable equilibrium between the two countries: neither fully a cold war nor a hot peace, but a strategic pregnant pause between intensifying conflicts. Ironically, India stands to lose much more than Pakistan from its bizarre strategic calculus. The first casualty is India’s carefully crafted narrative with regards to Pakistan and the disputed Kashmir region. Over the years, India had managed with varying success to ‘de-hyphenate’ itself from Pakistan, project Kashmir as a bilateral dispute, paint Pakistan as a sponsor of non-state proxies involved in cross-border terrorist activities, and isolate Pakistan diplomatically. By providing Pakistan with a permanent casus belli via suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty and working aggressively to dam the Indus basin waters that flow into the lower riparian, as well as by lowering the threshold of all-out war between the two nuclear-armed neighbours, India has all but ensured abiding international attention to, and eventual mediation in, the Kashmir dispute. Expecting that the rest of the world will ignore the danger of nuclear war caused by India’s escalatory and irresponsible actions is evidence of how disconnected its political leadership has become from ground realities. Apart from the diplomatic setback, equally damaging for India, or perhaps even more so, is the permanent harm Mr Modi’s political strategy is likely to inflict on India’s economy. While the Indian economy has not been exactly shining under Mr Modi, in large part causing the electoral setback BJP faced in the 2024 general elections and leading to the desperate beating of war drums witnessed recently, it is still well-positioned to gain substantially from the partial decoupling underway between the US and China. Along with Southeast Asia’s economic powerhouses such as Vietnam and Indonesia, India can potentially host supply chains for many of the advanced economies’ manufacturers that have been uprooted from China, or are planning to migrate. This opportunity to attract foreign investment is potentially worth anywhere between $500 billion to $1 trillion in the medium term in my estimate, and is there either for the taking, or for squandering. While India has begun to attract significant inflows of foreign direct investment over the past few years, inward FDI into India is still almost one-sixth of the foreign investment flows into mainland China — at $28bn in 2023 versus $163bn. The stock of FDI in India is an even lower fraction in comparison to mainland China. Before India fashions an even more reflexive strategy that brings the two quarrelling South Asian neighbours closer to the edge, it should draw lessons from 2002. Months of full-scale mobilisation of the two armies and a tense stand-off along the border led to foreign nationals, many working in India’s IT hubs of Bangalore and Chennai, fleeing in droves on specially chartered flights. With the lengthening shadow of nuclear Armageddon on the subcontinent, it will be moot if many choose to return in the next round. With so much at stake, India stands to lose big if it pursues its current path of confrontation. Instead of striving to become an economic growth node for the subcontinent, peacefully coexisting and trading with its neighbours, cooperating regionally to lift millions of South Asians out of poverty and illiteracy, and by becoming a beacon of a genuine inclusive democracy, the current Indian political leadership has chosen a very different path. History will not be kind. The writer has been a member of several past economic advisory councils under different prime ministers. Published in Dawn, May 24th, 2025

data.title: Lessons from history
data.description: THE tragic events of 1971 were a watershed moment — one of many — in Pakistan’s troubled history, when the nation conceived by the founding fathers was rent asunder by a brutal civil war, and later Indian involvement. In the aftermath of the recent hostilities with India, several references have been made to 1971 by the prime minister himself. On Thursday, while on a visit to Azad Kashmir, Shehbaz Sharif said that Operation Bunyanum Marsoos was “ divine retribution ” for 1971. Earlier, while visiting troops in Pasrur last week, he asserted that the military had “ avenged ” the 1971 war. While staunch defence of the country and the ability to fend off unwarranted Indian aggression are indeed something to be thankful for, we must not let triumphalism and hyperbole cloud our view of history, particularly of an event as traumatic as the separation of the eastern wing. The fact is that we have not had any national-level reckoning of the separation of East Pakistan , and the creation of Bangladesh. Resultantly, our rulers have, over the decades, continued to make the same mistakes that were made in the lead-up to the 1971 war. Political disputes in the former eastern wing were dealt with through administrative and later security steps, largely because of Ayub Khan’s long spell of military rule, followed by Yahya Khan’s mishandling of the crisis , which by that time had reached existential proportions. Politicians in both wings were not free of blame either; but the fact is that it was the martial rulers of the time who bore the ultimate responsibility for the loss of the eastern wing. No doubt, India played an extremely damaging role, meddling in what was essentially Pakistan’s internal matter and abetted the break-up. Considering these grim facts, is it apt for Mr Sharif to describe the recent thwarting of India’s hostile designs as revenge for the loss of East Pakistan? Instead of evoking triumphalism, the latest clash with India requires Pakistan to soberly reflect on both its internal and external challenges. Defence of the country is non-negotiable, and the administration along with the armed forces must remain vigilant. Yet it is equally important to face our internal challenges with sagacity and determination. Amongst the foremost of these is countering the wave of terrorism afflicting the nation, as well as reviving the economy. Internal political reconciliation is also essential. In short, there is much work to be done. Once we put Pakistan on the path to prosperity, where its people have health, education and sufficient employment, where constitutional protections are extended to each citizen, and there is peace in the larger neighbourhood, we can say that the losses of the past have been ‘avenged,’ and that Pakistan has risen. Published in Dawn, May 24th, 2025

data.title: Så tog sig Danmark från C-VM till VM-semifinal
data.description: Vägen till Danmarks första VM-semifinal har varit lång, och inte utan problem. Men på fredagen checkade de danska spelarna in på hotellet i Stockholm för att förbereda sig för lördagskvällens match mot Schweiz. Det lilla hockeylandet med stora drömmar har charmat publiken. Nu spelar de för en historisk medalj.

But on Friday, the Danish players checked into the hotel in Stockholm to prepare for Saturday night's match against Switzerland. The little hockey country with big dreams has charmed the audience. Now they play for a historical medal.

data.title: Hanna Hellquist: Att vara nära djuren är en religiös upplevelse
data.description: I vår är det 60 år sedan Kolmården öppnades. Hanna Hellquist tog med sig sin vän Ted till djuparken för att förstå varför man vill vara nära djur. ”Det jag känner när jag får vara nära en noshörning är vad jag tror att religiösa människor känner när de tar nattvarden”, skriver hon.
data.translatedTitle: Hanna Hellquist: Being close to the animals is a religious experience
data.translatedDescription: This spring it is 60 years since Kolmården was opened. Hanna Hellquist brought her friend Ted to Djuparken to understand why you want to be close to animals. "What I know when I get to be close to a rhino is what I think religious people feel when they take the communion," she writes.

data.title: Review: ‘The Eternaut’ — compelling post-apocalyptic sci-fi from Argentina
data.description: DUBAI: At first, it seems like “The Eternaut” is going to be a climate-crisis-focused piece. It’s summer and Buenos Aires is boiling in more ways than one — demonstrations against government incompetence rage on the streets while power cuts only increase the oppressive heat felt by residents. Then a sudden fall of deadly radioactive snow kills hundreds of thousands instantly.

data.title: Trump says he wants to ‘end conflicts not start them’
data.description:
DOHA: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said he wanted to "end conflicts not start them" as he addressed troops at the United States' sprawling Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar.

	Trump visited a US base installation at the center of American involvement in the Middle East as he uses his four-day visit to Gulf states to reject the “interventionism” of America’s past in the region.

data.title: Egypt approves $221m of oil exploration deals with foreign firms
data.description:
RIYADH: Egypt has approved $221 million worth of deals with foreign firms for oil exploration and exploitation in the Western Desert and Gulf of Suez.

	A statement issued following a meeting of the country’s Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly, said ministers had signed off on five draft petroleum commitment agreements.

	The deals involve the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp., the Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., and a group of international oil companies.

	The deals involve the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp., the Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., and a group of international oil companies.

data.title: IEA forecasts slowdown in global oil demand growth for the rest of 2025
data.description:
LONDON: The International Energy Agency said on Thursday economic headwinds combined with record sales of electric vehicles will reduce global oil demand growth to 650,000 barrels per day for the remainder of 2025.

	That marks a slowdown from the 990,000 bpd the IEA measured for demand growth over January-March.

	“Increased trade uncertainty is expected to weigh on the world economy and, by extension, oil demand,” the IEA said in its May oil market report.
data.translatedTitle: IEA forecasts slowdown in global oil demand growth for the rest of 2025
data.translatedDescription:

	“Increased trade uncertainty is expected to weigh on the world economy and, by extension, oil demand,” the IEA said in its May oil market report.

data.title: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.description:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.
data.translatedTitle: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT

data.title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.description:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.
data.translatedTitle: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.translatedDescription:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.

data.title: Ben Sulayem drives major improvements to FIA’s international Sporting Code
data.description: DUBAI: The Federation Internationale de l’Automobile, the global governing body for motor sport and the federation for mobility organizations worldwide, has announced that it is to make major improvements to Appendix B of its International Sporting Code following an extensive review commissioned by FIA’s President Mohammed Ben Sulayem.

data.title: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks
data.description:
ISTANBUL: Russia’s delegation arrived in Istanbul for peace talks with Ukraine, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said Thursday, and a Ukrainian official said a delegation including President Volodymyr Zelensky was on its way the the Turkish capital Ankara.

	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.

data.title: Lufthansa group suspends Tel Aviv flights following Houthi attacks on Israel
data.description:
BERLIN: Airline group Lufthansa will suspend its flights to Tel Aviv through May 25, it said on Thursday, citing the “current situation.”
	This affects flights operated by Lufthansa, Swiss, Austrian Airlines, Eurowings, ITA Airways, Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa Cargo, it added.
	Global airlines have again halted their flights to and from Tel Aviv after a missile fired by Yemen’s Houthis toward Israel on May 4 landed near the country’s main international airport in Tel Aviv.

data.title: Al-Ain to host 6th IMMAF Youth World Championships in July
data.description:
ABU DHABI: The UAE Jiu-Jitsu and Mixed Martial Arts Federation has announced that the sixth IMMAF Youth World Championships will be held in Al-Ain Region for the first time from July 21-27.

	The tournament will be staged at the Al-Ain Convention Center with more than 1,000 male and female athletes from 60 countries competing in the championship’s largest event to date.

A través de un comunicado, su secretario general nacional Yandir Loggiodice denunció que arrestar a Guanipa es una clara muestra del “terrorismo de Estado” y revela el nerviosismo que el gobierno […] La entrada El Partido Centro Democrático calificó detención de Guanipa como “terrorismo de Estado” se publicó primero en EL NACIONAL .

data.title: EE UU expresa preocupación por las acciones de Maduro antes de las elecciones del domingo
data.description: La Embajada de Estados Unidos expresó este viernes preocupación por las recientes acciones del gobierno de Nicolás Maduro, justo a días de las elecciones regionales y parlamentarias del domingo. A través de un comunicado, la sede diplomática destacó: “Hoy, el régimen de Maduro intensificó su uso de una guerra jurídica para silenciar arbitrariamente a destacadas voces […] La entrada EE UU expresa preocupación por las acciones de Maduro antes de las elecciones del domingo se publicó primero en EL NACIONAL .

data.title: Trukai Fun Run Auction raises K258,000 for team PNG ahead of Pacific Mini Games
data.description: The 2025 Trukai Fun Run Auction, held on Friday, May 23rd, at The Stanley Hotel, successfully raised a significant K258,000 to support Team PNG's participation in the upcoming Pacific Mini Games in Palau. With less than 37 days until the games commence on June 29th, the funds are critical for the national contingent. The post Trukai Fun Run Auction raises K258,000 for team PNG ahead of Pacific Mini Games appeared first on Post Courier .

data.title: The future of American soft power
data.description: Cambridge-MA, USA This text is the final commentary written by Joseph S. Nye, Jr., a giant of international relations, before his death on 6 May 2025. It caps a rich legacy of field-defining insights into the workings of global politics. Nye coined the term soft power in the late 1980s, and it first came into widespread usage following a piece he wrote in Foreign Policy in 1990. In 2012, Nye of Harvard University explained that with soft power, "the best propaganda is not propaganda", further explaining that during the Information Age, "credibility is the scarcest resource". By Joseph S. Nye, Jr. CAMBRIDGE – Power is the ability to get others to do what you want. That can be accomplished by coercion (“sticks”), payment (“carrots”), and attraction (“honey”). The first two methods are forms of hard power, whereas attraction is soft power. Soft power grows out of a country’s culture, its political values, and its foreign policies. In the short term, hard power usually trumps soft power. But over the long term, soft power often prevails. Joseph Stalin once mockingly asked, “How many divisions does the Pope have?” But the papacy continues today, while Stalin’s Soviet Union is long gone. When you are attractive, you can economize on carrots and sticks. If allies see you as benign and trustworthy, they are more likely to be open to persuasion and follow your lead. If they see you as an unreliable bully, they are more likely to drag their feet and reduce their interdependence when they can. Cold War Europe is a good example. A Norwegian historian described Europe as divided into a Soviet and an American empire. But there was a crucial difference: the American side was “an empire by invitation.” That became clear when the Soviets had to deploy troops to Budapest in 1956, and to Prague in 1968. In contrast, NATO has not only survived but voluntarily increased its membership. A proper understanding of power must include both its hard and soft aspects. Machiavelli said it was better for a prince to be feared than to be loved. But it is best to be both. Because soft power is rarely sufficient by itself, and because its effects take longer to realize, political leaders are often tempted to resort to the hard power of coercion or payment. When wielded alone, however, hard power can involve higher costs than when it is combined with the soft power of attraction. The Berlin Wall did not succumb to an artillery barrage; it was felled by hammers and bulldozers wielded by people who had lost faith in Communism and were drawn to Western values. After World War II , the United States was by far the most powerful country, and it attempted to enshrine its values in what became known as “the liberal international order” – a framework comprising the United Nations, the Bretton Woods economic institutions, and other multilateral bodies. Of course, the US did not always live up to its liberal values, and Cold War bipolarity limited this order to only half the world’s people. But the postwar system would have looked very different if the Axis powers had won WWII and imposed their values. While prior US presidents have violated aspects of the liberal order, Donald Trump is the first to reject the idea that soft power has any value in foreign policy. Among his first actions upon returning to office was to withdraw from the Paris climate agreement and the World Health Organization, despite the obvious threats that climate change and pandemics pose. The effects of a US administration surrendering soft power are all too predictable. Coercing democratic allies like Denmark or Canada weakens trust in our alliances. Threatening Panama reawakens fears of imperialism throughout Latin America. Crippling the US Agency for International Development ( USAID ) – created by President John F. Kennedy in 1961 – undercuts our reputation for benevolence. Silencing Voice of America is a gift to authoritarian rivals. Slapping tariffs on friends makes us appear unreliable. Trying to chill free speech at home undermines our credibility. This list could go on. Trump has defined China as America’s great challenge, and China itself has been investing in soft power since 2007, when then-Chinese President Hu Jintao told the Communist Party of China that the country needs to make itself more attractive to others. But China has long faced two major obstacles in this respect. First, it maintains territorial disputes with multiple neighbors. Second, the CPC insists on maintaining tight control over civil society. The costs of such policies have been confirmed by public opinion polls that ask people around the world which countries they find attractive. But one can only wonder what these surveys will show in future years if Trump keeps undercutting American soft power. To be sure, American soft power has had its ups and downs over the years. The US was unpopular in many countries during the Vietnam and Iraq wars. But soft power derives from a country’s society and culture as well as from government actions. Even during the Vietnam War, when crowds marched through streets around the world to protest US policies, they sang the American civil-rights anthem “We Shall Overcome.” An open society that allows protest can be a soft-power asset. But will America’s cultural soft power survive a downturn in the government’s soft power over the next four years? American democracy is likely to survive four years of Trump. The country has a resilient political culture and a federal constitution that encourages checks and balances. There is a reasonable chance that Democrats will regain control of the House of Representatives in the 2026 elections. Moreover, civil society remains strong, and the courts independent. Many organizations have launched lawsuits to challenge Trump’s actions, and markets have signaled dissatisfaction with Trump’s economic policies. American soft power recovered after low points in the Vietnam and Iraq wars, as well as from a dip in Trump’s first term. But once trust is lost, it is not easily restored. After the invasion of Ukraine, Russia lost most of what soft power it had, but China is striving to fill any gaps that Trump creates. The way Chinese President Xi Jinping tells it, the East is rising over the West. If Trump thinks he can compete with China while weakening trust among American allies, asserting imperial aspirations, destroying USAID , silencing Voice of America, challenging laws at home, and withdrawing from UN agencies, he is likely to fail. Restoring what he has destroyed will not be impossible, but it will be costly. - Joseph S. Nye, Jr., was Dean of Harvard Kennedy School, a US assistant secretary of defense, and the author of the memoir A Life in the American Century (Polity Press, 2024). -- Copyright: Project Syndicate, 2025. https://www.project-syndicate.org/about : “Project Syndicate produces and delivers original, high-quality commentaries to a global audience. Featuring exclusive contributions by prominent political leaders, policymakers, scholars, business leaders, and civic activists from around the world, we provide news media and their readers with cutting-edge analysis and insight, regardless of ability to pay. Our membership includes over 500 media outlets – more than half of which receive our commentaries for free or at subsidized rates – in 156 countries. We believe the entire world deserves access to its greatest minds. Our mission is to reach those without this opportunity.” politics foreign affairs United States of America soft power Joseph S. Nye Jr. Op-Ed World Affairs

data.title: Gilo Fezzo: De taxista youtuber a trabajar en Granma (+Audio y Video)
data.description: Hace unos dos años descubrimos en las calles de La Habana a un personaje sui géneris. Buen chofer, cortés con el público y excelente comunicador. Daba rueda desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, cubriendo la ruta 10 de la capital, que incluía el trayecto Playa-Regla. Hoy, alzar la voz a favor de la verdad de Cuba continúa siendo su esencia. The post Gilo Fezzo: De taxista youtuber a trabajar en Granma (+Audio y Video) first appeared on Cubadebate .

data.translatedDescription: About two years ago we discovered in the streets of Havana a sui generis character. Good driver, Cortés with the public and excellent communicator. It gave Rueda from eight in the morning until nine o'clock at night, covering Route 10 of the capital, which included the beach-regla route. Today, raising the voice in favor of the truth of Cuba continues to be its essence. The Post Gilo Fezzo: from Taxista YouTuber to work in Granma (+audio and video) First Appeared on Cubadebate.

data.title: Etecsa alerta sobre estafas con una recarga internacional
data.description: Durante los últimos años han proliferado sitios web fraudulentos que, en la mayoría de los casos, clonan identificaciones y mensajes de Etecsa. Estos ofrecen opciones atractivas de recarga internacional, pero en no pocas ocasiones los que la reciben en Cuba no gozan de todos sus beneficios. The post Etecsa alerta sobre estafas con una recarga internacional first appeared on Cubadebate .
data.translatedTitle: Etecsa alert about scams with an international recharge
data.translatedDescription: In recent years, fraudulent websites have proliferated that, in most cases, clone identifications and messages of Etecsa. These offer attractive options for international recharge, but on a few occasions those who receive it in Cuba do not enjoy all its benefits. The post Etecsa alert about scams with an international recharge First Appeared on Cubadebate.

data.title: Tigres vencen a Industriales en semifinal de la Liga Élite
data.description: Los avileños perdían 1x5 a la altura del quinto inning, pero fabricaron decisivo e inalcanzable racimo de cinco carreras para adelantarse en el marcador (6x5), dados cuatro jits incluido triple de Leonelkis Escalante con dos en bases frente al primer relevista Fher Cejas. También hubo un error rival. The post Tigres vencen a Industriales en semifinal de la Liga Élite first appeared on Cubadebate .
data.translatedTitle: Tigres beat industrialists in the semifinal of the elite league
data.translatedDescription: The Avileños lost 1x5 at the height of the fifth inning, but manufactured decisive and unattainable five -run cluster to get ahead on the scoreboard (6x5), given four Jits included triple from Leonelkis Escalante with two in bases against the first relister Fher Cejas. There was also a rival error. The Post Tigres defeat industrialists in the semifinal of the Elite First Appeared On Cubadebate League.

data.title: Brasil destaca legado del legendario fotógrafo Sebastiao Salgado, fallecido este viernes
data.description: El presidente Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, el cantautor Gilberto Gil y otras personalidades e instituciones de Brasil y del mundo, como la Academia de Bellas Artes francesa, destacaron la extraordinaria obra y el legado humano del fotógrafo Sebastiao Salgado, fallecido este viernes a los 81 años de edad. The post Brasil destaca legado del legendario fotógrafo Sebastiao Salgado, fallecido este viernes first appeared on Cubadebate .
data.translatedTitle: Brazil highlights legacy of the legendary photographer Sebastiao Salgado, who died this Friday

The Post Brazil highlights legacy of the legendary photographer Sebastiao Salgado, who died this Friday First Appeared on Cubadebate.

data.title: "Los Cachiros" grabaron y sobornaron a Romeo Vásquez en la campaña 2013
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- El cartel de ' Los Cachiros ' grabó y entregó dinero en efectivo al general en retiro Romeo Orlando Vásquez Velásquez en 2013, cuando este se postulaba como candidato presidencial por la Alianza Patriótica Hondureña. Fuentes del Ministerio Público confirmaron que cuatro videos filmados ese año muestran al exjefe de las Fuerzas Armadas recibiendo sobornos del narcotraficante Devis Leonel Rivera , que luego se entregaría a Estados Unidos. Las grabaciones fueron utilizadas como parte de una acusación formal presentada este viernes por la Fiscalía Especial Contra el Crimen Organizado (FESCCO). Vásquez -en esta acusación- enfrenta cargos por lavado de activos agravado en perjuicio del orden socioeconómico del Estado de Honduras. Aunque los videos no han sido divulgados públicamente, peritos del Laboratorio de Video Forense de la Dirección de Medicina Legal confirmaron su autenticidad y validez técnica. Además del material audiovisual, la FESCCO incorporó pericias financieras que revelan movimientos bancarios irregulares en cuentas asociadas al imputado, sin respaldo económico lícito. “El Ministerio Público reafirma su compromiso de actuar con firmeza y legalidad frente al crimen organizado”, señaló la institución en un comunicado. Vásquez, también, enfrenta cargos por el crimen de Isy Obed Murillo ocurrido en plena crisis política de 2009, que culminó con el derrocamiento de Manuel Zelaya.
data.translatedTitle: "Los Cachiros" recorded and bribed Romeo Vásquez in the 2013 campaign
data.translatedDescription: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.- The 'Los Cachiros' poster recorded and delivered cash to the Romo Orlando Vásquez Velásquez retirement in 2013, when he was running as a presidential candidate for the Honduran Patriotic Alliance. Sources from the Public Ministry confirmed that four videos filmed that year show the former chief of the Armed Forces receiving bribes from the drug trafficker Devis Leonel Rivera, which would then be delivered to the United States. The recordings were used as part of a formal accusation presented this Friday by the Special Prosecutor's Office against Organized Crime (FESCCO). Vásquez - in this accusation - faces charges for money laundering aggravated to the detriment of the socioeconomic order of the State of Honduras. Although the videos have not been publicly released, experts of the Forensic Video Laboratory of the Directorate of Legal Medicine confirmed its authenticity and technical validity. In addition to the audiovisual material, the FESCCO incorporated financial expertise that reveals irregular banking movements in accounts associated with the accused, without lawful economic support. "The Public Ministry reaffirms its commitment to act with firmness and legality against organized crime," the institution said in a statement. Vásquez, also, faces positions for the crime of Isy Obed Murillo that occurred in the middle of the political crisis of 2009, which culminated in the overthrow of Manuel Zelaya.

ner.entity: Special Prosecutor's Office against Organized Crime
ner.label: ORG

data.title: Romeo Vásquez reacciona tras nuevo requerimiento y publica caso de "Carlón" en 1977
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- Luego que el Ministerio Público (MP) hiciera oficial el requerimiento fiscal por lavado de activos, Romeo Vásquez reaccionó en redes sociales. El exjefe de las Fuerzas Armadas está prófugo de la justicia desde el mes de abril, cuando debía asistir a una audiencia por los delitos de asesinato y tentativa de asesinato. En el nuevo requerimiento se establece que Vásquez recibió dinero de narcotraficantes que fueron extraditados a Estados Unidos , según la Fiscalía. Minutos después del comunicado de la Fiscalía, Vásquez compartió en sus redes sociales la imagen de un artículo de prensa donde se detalla un auto de prisión que recibió Carlos Zelaya en 1977, hermano del expresidente Manuel Zelaya Rosales y exsecretario del Congreso Nacional (CN) . El artículo es de 1977 y precisa que Zelaya obtuvo un auto de prisión por complicidad en la muerte de Camilo Girón y Salomón Kaffati. Añade que Carlos Zelaya afrontó varias acusaciones, incluida una que presentó una del Juzgado de Letras de Menores . "Hay un video que ha sido analizado por peritos, él recibe dinero en efectivo de narcos que posteriormente fueron trasladados a Estados Unidos. Se recibieron algunas denuncias y es una investigación que ya lleva su tiempo", indicó Yuri Mora , director de comunicaciones del Ministerio Público . A Mora se le consultó por qué se actúa contra Vásquez si la fuente es un video, pero no se ha hecho lo mismo en el caso de Carlos Zelaya , quien fue vinculado en septiembre de 2024 a un video tomado en 2013, donde se le veía recibiendo dinero de líderes de cárteles en Honduras. "No quiere decir que otros videos no se deje de investigar, la diferencia con este video es que Romeo recibe el dinero, lo mete en una bolsa y estos narcotraficantes se lo entregan; cuánto no se sabe porque en la plática que tienen no se detalla cuánto es. Son paquetes de dinero y los mete en una bolsa negra", respondió Mora.
data.translatedTitle: Romeo Vásquez reacts after a new requirement and publishes case of "Carlón" in 1977
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- After the Public Ministry (MP) made official the fiscal requirement for money laundering, Romeo Vásquez reacted on social networks. The former Chief of the Armed Forces is a fugitive from justice since April, when he had to attend an audience for the crimes of murder and attempt to murder. The new requirement establishes that Vásquez received money from drug traffickers who were extradited to the United States, according to the Prosecutor's Office. Minutes after the prosecutor's statement, Vásquez shared on his social networks the image of a press article detailed a prison car received by Carlos Zelaya in 1977, brother of former president Manuel Zelaya Rosales and former secretary of the National Congress (CN). The article is from 1977 and requires that Zelaya obtained a prison car due to complicity in the death of Camilo Girón and Solomón Kaffati. He adds that Carlos Zelaya faced several accusations, including one that presented one of the Court of Letters of Minors. "There is a video that has been analyzed by experts, he receives drug money from drug traffickers who were subsequently transferred to the United States. Some complaints were received and it is an investigation that has been taking time," said Yuri Mora, communications director of the Public Ministry. Mora was consulted why he acts against Vásquez if the source is a video, but the same has not been done in the case of Carlos Zelaya, who was linked in September 2024 to a video taken in 2013, where he was seen receiving money from cartel leaders in Honduras. "It does not mean that other videos do not stop investigating, the difference with this video is that Romeo receives the money, puts it in a bag and these drug traffickers give it to it; how much it is not known because in the talk they have it does not detail how much it is. They are money packages and put them in a black bag," Mora replied.

data.translatedTitle: Haiti-crime: several bandits killed during a muscular police operation in Pernier
data.translatedDescription: An indeterminate number of bandits were killed, this Thursday, May 22, 2025, in a muscular police operation in Pernier (Pétionville (east of the capital, Port-au-Prince).-Through Haiti

data.title: Les Évêques catholiques d'Haïti condamnent le massacre de dizaines de civils innocents dans l'Artibonite
data.description: La Conférence épiscopale d'Haïti condamne le massacre du 20 mai 2025 à Préval (Artibonite), appelle à la justice pour les victimes, et interpelle l'État sur son inaction face à la violence qui ravage le pays. - Dépêches
data.translatedTitle: The Catholic bishops of Haiti condemn the massacre of dozens of innocent civilians in the Artibonite
data.translatedDescription: The episcopal conference of Haiti condemns the massacre of May 20, 2025 in Préval (Artibonite), calls for justice for the victims, and challenges the State on its inaction in the face of violence which ravages the country. - dispatches

data.title: Haïti-Education : L'impasse d'une grève sans trêve
data.description: Dans une tribune transmise à AlterPresse, Jean Willy Belfleur analyse la grève illimitée des enseignants en Haïti, ses fondements, ses faiblesses tactiques et ses effets sur l'année scolaire. Il alerte sur l'essoufflement d'un mouvement privé de stratégie, à l'heure où l'éducation publique s'enfonce dans l'impasse. - AlterForo
data.translatedTitle: Haiti-Education: the dead end of a strike without truce
data.translatedDescription: In a column transmitted to Alterpresse, Jean Willy Belfleur analyzes the unlimited strike of teachers in Haiti, its foundations, its tactical weaknesses and its effects on the school year. He alerts the output of a private strategy movement, at a time when public education is sinking into the dead end. - Alteriform

data.title: Haïti – Société : Submergé par la violence des gangs et l'exode, le Plateau Central au bord du gouffre
data.description: Le Plateau Central fait face à une crise humanitaire et socioéconomique sans précédent, aggravée par l'exode massif de populations fuyant les gangs. À Hinche, insalubrité, inflation, services débordés et appels à l'aide se multiplient dans un silence pesant du pouvoir central. - A travers Haiti
data.translatedTitle: Haiti - Society: submerged by the violence of the gangs and the exodus, the central plateau by the abyss
data.translatedDescription: The central plateau faces an unprecedented humanitarian and socioeconomic crisis, aggravated by the mass exodus of populations fleeing the gangs. In Hinche, insalubrity, inflation, overwhelmed services and calls for help multiply in a heavy silence of central power. - Through Haiti

data.title: Haïti condamne officiellement les abus xénophobes contre ses ressortissant·e·s en République Dominicaine
data.description: Le gouvernement haïtien dénonce les violations répétées des droits humains infligées aux migrant·e·s haïtiens en République Dominicaine, notamment les femmes enceintes, et appelle à la solidarité nationale et internationale. - Dépêches
data.translatedTitle: Haiti officially condemns xenophobic abuses against his nationals in the Dominican Republic
data.translatedDescription: The Haitian government denounces repeated human rights violations imposed on Haitian migrants in the Dominican Republic, notably pregnant women, and calls for national and international solidarity. - dispatches

data.title: Haïti – Violences : Récit d'une nouvelle hécatombe dans la vallée de l'Artibonite
data.description: Dans la vallée de l'Artibonite, une opération sanglante menée par des groupes armés d'autodéfense a fait au moins 24 morts, selon un témoignage bouleversant recueilli par AlterRadio. - A travers Haiti
data.translatedTitle: Haiti - Violence: story of a new massacre in the Artibonite valley
data.translatedDescription: In the Artibonite valley, a bloody operation led by armed groups of self -defense left at least 24 dead, according to an overwhelming testimony collected by Alterradio. - Through Haiti

data.title: Oea : Le gouvernement haïtien continue d'alerter sur une crise sécuritaire sans précédent en Haïti
data.description: Haïti fait face à la pire crise sécuritaire de son histoire, selon le ministre Patrick Pellissier, qui alerte sur la montée en puissance des gangs armés lors d'un symposium international à Washington, suivi par AlterPresse. - Dépêches
data.translatedTitle: Oea: The Haitian government continues to alert an unprecedented security crisis in Haiti
data.translatedDescription: Haiti faces the worst security crisis in its history, according to Minister Patrick Pellissier, who alerts the rise of armed gangs during an international symposium in Washington, followed by Alterpresse. - dispatches

data.title: Haïti-RD-Migration : La République Dominicaine viole ses engagements internationaux, selon un collectif français de solidarité
data.description: Dans une lettre ouverte en date du 16 mai 2025, adressée au ministre français des affaires étrangères , le Collectif Haïti de France s'élève contre les violences et les politiques« discriminatoires » et « d'épuration ethnique » du gouvernement de la République Dominicaine envers les migrantes et migrants haïtien-ne-s, et les Dominicaines et Dominicains noir-e-s. - Documents
data.translatedTitle: Haiti-RD-Migration: The Dominican Republic violates its international commitments, according to a French solidarity collective
data.translatedDescription: In an open letter dated May 16, 2025, addressed to the French Minister of Foreign Affairs, the Haiti collective of France rises against violence and "discriminatory" and "ethnic purification" policies of the government of the Dominican Republic towards the Haitian-Ne-S migrants, and the Dominicans and Dominicans Noir-e-e. - Documents

data.title: Albert Ramdin prend les rênes de l'Oea avec Haïti comme priorité brûlante
data.description: Le diplomate surinamais Albert Ramdin prend la tête de l'Oea le 25 mai 2025, alors que la crise haïtienne s'impose comme une priorité urgente. Washington pousse l'organisation à renforcer son rôle face à l'insécurité croissante. - Perspectives
data.translatedTitle: Albert Ramdin takes the reins of the Oea with Haiti as a burning priority
data.translatedDescription: Diplomat Surinamels Albert Ramdin took the head of the OEA on May 25, 2025, while the Haitian crisis established itself as an urgent priority. Washington pushes the organization to strengthen its role in the face of increasing insecurity. - Perspectives

data.title: Haïti : Plusieurs bandits tués à Mirebalais toujours sous l'emprise des gangs
data.description: La Police nationale d'Haïti (Pnh) annonce la mort de plusieurs bandits et la saisie d'armes, lors d'une opération le mardi 20 mai 2025 dans les environs de Péligre, dans le Plateau central. - A travers Haiti
data.translatedTitle: Haiti: Several bandits killed in Mirebalais always under the influence of gangs
data.translatedDescription: The National Police of Haiti (PNH) announce the death of several bandits and the seizure of arms, during an operation on Tuesday, May 20, 2025 in the vicinity of Péligre, in the central plateau. - Through Haiti

data.title: Haïti : Le document final pour une conférence nationale bientôt remis aux autorités
data.description: L'équipe de transition annonce des avancées dans les démarches pour aboutir à une conférence nationale, à la tenue d'un référendum sur une nouvelle Constitution, malgré la situation de terreur des gangs terroristes sur le territoire d'Haïti. - Perspectives
data.translatedTitle: Haiti: the final document for a national conference soon given to the authorities
data.translatedDescription: The transition team announces advances in the steps to reach a national conference, the holding of a referendum on a new constitution, despite the situation of terror of terrorist gangs on the territory of Haiti. - Perspectives

data.title: Haïti : Didier Dominique, l'engagement militant d'un intellectuel au service des travailleurs
data.description: Didier Dominique, figure majeure du syndicalisme haïtien, est décédé le 18 mai 2025. Intellectuel engagé et militant infatigable, il laisse un héritage puissant dans la lutte ouvrière, la défense des droits humains et la pensée critique, témoigne Yannick Étienne dans un hommage sur AlterPresse. - Perspectives
data.translatedTitle: Haiti: Didier Dominique, the militant commitment of an intellectual in the service of workers
data.translatedDescription: Didier Dominique, a major figure in Haitian unionism, died on May 18, 2025. Intelligence committed and tireless militant, he leaves a powerful legacy in the workers' struggle, the defense of human rights and critical thinking, testifies Yannick Étienne in a tribute to Alterpresse. - Perspectives

The exhibition invites the visitor to think, photograph and sometimes just sweat in the heat, writes Hendrik Alla, the head of cultural editorial office.

data.title: Taani šokeeris Kanadat ja korraldas veel ühe ime jääl. Meenutame teisi (väikeste) kangelaslikke spordiimesid
data.description: Kui 1980. aasta taliolümpiamängudel Lake Placidis võitis kuldmedali USA hokimeeskond, nimetati seda imeks jääl – miracle on ice. 45 aastat hiljem kordas seda Taani, alistades MMi veerandfinaalis kodujääl Kanada 2:1.
data.translatedTitle: Denmark shocked Canada and organized another miracle on the ice. We remember others (small) heroic sports wonders
data.translatedDescription: When the US hockey team won the gold medal at the 1980 Winter Olympics, it was called a miracle on the ice - Miracle on Ice. 45 years later, Denmark repeated it, defeating Canada 2: 1 in the World Championship in the quarter -finals.

data.title: BLOGI ⟩ 1186. sõjapäev Ukrainas: Linnapea: Kiiev langes kombineeritud drooni- ja raketirünnaku alla
data.description: 2022. aasta 24. veebruaril alustas Venemaa režiimi juht Vladimir Putin sissetungi Ukrainasse. Pärast seda, kui Ukraina lõi tagasi pealetungi Kiievile, on lahingute kese kandunud Ida- ja Lõuna-Ukrainasse. Postimees kajastab 1186. sõjapäeva sündmusi allolevas blogis.
data.translatedTitle: Blog⟩ 1186. War Day in Ukraine: Mayor: Kiev fell under a combined drone and rocket attack
data.translatedDescription: On February 24, 2022, Vladimir Putin, the head of the Russian regime, began an invasion of Ukraine. After Ukraine has returned to Kiev, the center of the battles has been transferred to eastern and southern Ukraine. Postimees reflects the events of the 1186 war on the blog below.

data.title: Valter Parve: Algul ma ei teadnudki, et mulle meeldib koolis töötada
data.description: Kui koolmeister ja koolijuht, malevapealik, omavalitsustöötaja, sotsiaalvaldkonna edendaja, kõrgkooli õppejõud, Gori sõprade seltsi asutaja ja asendamatu eestvedaja, hobiaednik ja vinüülplaadigurmaan Valter Parve tähistas veebruari algul oma 80. sünnipäeva, oli mõte teha temaga lehelugu. Toona arvas ta, et lükkame selle edasi soojemale ajale. Nüüd oli siinkirjutaja  kimbatuses: mida võtta, mida jätta? Soovimata kasutada kulunud ajakirjanduslikku klišeed mehest kui orkestrist, mis Valteri kohta, sest nii teda sõbrad hüüavad, väga hästi sobib.
data.translatedTitle: Valter Parve: At first I didn't know I like to work at school
data.translatedDescription: If the schoolmaster and school leader, chief chief, municipal worker, social promoter, college lecturer, founder and indispensable leader of the Gori Friends Society, hobbyist and vinyl recorder Valter Parve celebrated his 80th birthday in early February, the idea was to do a page story. At that time he thought we would postpone it to a warmer time. Now the writer was embarrassed: what to take, what to leave? data.title: AK FOOKUS ⟩ Guardiani kriitik: Eesti paviljon paneb Veneetsias kõva laksu
data.description: Kui eestlane Veneetsias mööda Garibaldi tänavat lonkides laguuni äärde jõuab ja sealt vasakule, Giardini poole pöörab, tabab teda déjà vu: nagu oleks jupike kodusest magalamäe majast siia sattunud. Romantiliselt laigulise pastelse krohvikihi asemel uhkeldab selle nurk kiiskavvalgete soojustuspaneelidega ja kodusest linnapildist tuttava kujundusega tänavasilt ütleb «Estonian Pavilion 25».
data.translatedTitle: AK Focus⟩ Guardian Critic: The Estonian Pavilion puts a hard slap in Venice
data.translatedDescription: When an Estonian in Venice is limping to Garibaldi Street by the lagoon and turning to the left of Giardin, he is hit by Déjà Vu: as if he had come here from the Magalamäe House. Instead of a romantically patchy pastel plaster layer, its angle is boasting with a streets of shimmering white and a street -friendly street design that says "Estonian Pavilion 25".

data.title: DSP o Maquiavélico Ganancioso
data.description: Guineenses, mais uma vez, venho para vos alertar sobre o perigo que Domingos Simões Pereira representa para a Guiné-Bissau. Faço esse alerta a todos os guineenses sem exceção que se encontre no país ou no estrangeiro, ao PAIGC em especial e na pessoa do Cipriano Cassamá em concreto. Alerta esse sobre o verdadeiro DSP, o verdadeiro espírito que move esse sujeito, o qual alguns ainda continuam a acreditar para não dizer adorar. Domingos Simões Pereira é um manipulador, um verdadeiro chantagista e calculista provavelmente, tipo de comportamento que ultrapassa o nível de psicopata. U m ambicioso desmedido, um verdadeiro criminoso que sabe como e quando cometer o crime. Ele jamais coabitaria não só com JOMAV, assim como com qualquer presidente que seria eleito, a não ser o que ele apoiou disfarçadamente. Isto porque ele tem sua própria agenda, e o PAIGC é simplesmente uma plataforma para sua concretização. DSP jamais coabitaria com JOMAV porque o seu candidato preferido era o Paulo Gomes e sempre será, o qual juntamente com Tchitchi vão delineando mecanismo de modo a serem os novos donos da Guiné-Bissau. Segundo eles este é um processo a médio prazo, e é preciso coragem e paciência para concretiza-lo. Ganhar o congresso não importa em que circunstância e ter novamente o partido na mão, é uma fase concluída em proveito deles, enquanto verdadeiros militantes do PAIGC estão a bater palmas. Depois dessa eleição legislativa, não importa o resultado, o Cipriano Cassama que se prepare a mala ou fica de bico fechado, pois o candidato preferido para o partido será o Paulo Gomes, e esse sim deve ter a voz dentro do partido. DSP é um ambicioso desmedido, nunca teve consideração por ninguém, JOMAV muito menos, o sujeito é um maquiavélico nato, Cipriano Casama será descartado quando menos esperar podes tomar a nota. Guineenses, falar do Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi é falar do MCCI e demais outras organizações e personalidades camufladas no nosso país. Esses dois indivíduos são os principais financiadores do MCCI e demais outras personalidades boca de aluguel na cidade de Bissau. O MCCI, Milícia idealizado por JBV e DSP, agora financiado e dirigido por "futuro triângulo do poder" ou seja, "DSP, Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi", têm 3 principais objectivos: 1º Perturbar a ordem pública em nome da cidadania, difamar e tentar descredibilizar qualquer que seja organizações ou indivíduos não alinhados ao triângulo, de modo a suportar suas caminhadas na busca do poder. 2º Caso se concretize o objectivo do triângulo, o papel da Milícia do MCCI passará a ser de vigilância constante a todos os adversários de modo a garantir falsa paz social e o poder de controlo. 3º Tentar ganhar credibilidade junto das organizações internacionais e regionais, através de suas visitas e actividades de fachada, para quando houver as tais actividades de perturbações de ordem pública, poderem ganhar notoriedade. Mas isso não deve preocupar ninguém, pois estão bem identificados e bem caçados, dentro e fora da Guiné-Bissau. Não tenho nada contra ninguém, mas quem continuar a perturbar verdadeira paz social dos guineenses em troca de benefícios como sempre foi nos últimos anos dessa crise, e que sempre tenho tolerado, então que fique claro "estou firme e determinado para tudo e todos". Para finalizar, gostaria de vos deixar uma reflexão com a seguinte frase: " Domingos Simões Pereira é um perigo grave para o futuro do país ". Isto porque publicar aqui tudo que é necessário para provar ou sustentar a razão dessa frase, só pode agravar ainda mais a paz social que tanto necessitamos. Chega, chega não podemos continuar a viver nessa turbulência vida toda, meus irmãos guineenses, não é saudável, é tóxico, não é justo para um povo que tanto sofreu. António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: DSP The greedy Machiavellian
data.translatedDescription: Guineans, once again, come to alert you to the danger that Domingos Simões Pereira represents to Guinea-Bissau. I make this alert to all Guineans without exception that you are in the country or abroad, to the PAIGC in particular and the person of Cyprian Cassamá in concrete. Warns this about the true DSP, the true spirit that moves this subject, which some still continue to believe not to say to worship. Domingos Simões Pereira is a manipulator, a real blackmailer and calculator, probably, kind of behavior that goes beyond the psychopath level. An ambitious excessive, a true criminal who knows how and when to commit the crime. He would never cohabble not only with Jomav, as well as with any president who would be elected, except what he supported undercover. This is because it has its own agenda, and PAIGC is simply a platform for its realization. DSP would never cohabble with Jomav because his favorite candidate was Paulo Gomes and always will be, who together with Tchitchi are outlining mechanism so that they are the new owners of Guinea-Bissau. According to them this is a process in the medium term, and it takes courage and patience to realize it. Winning Congress does not matter under what circumstances and have the party again in hand, it is a phase completed for them, while true PAIGC militants are clapping. After this legislative election, no matter the result, Cipriano Cassama who prepares the suitcase or is closed, because the favorite candidate for the party will be Paulo Gomes, and this must have his voice inside the party. DSP is an ambitious excessive, never considered by anyone, much less Jomav, the subject is a born Machiavellian, Cyprian Casama will be discarded when least expecting you can take the note. Guineans, talking about Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi is talking about MCCI and other other camouflaged organizations and personalities in our country. These two individuals are MCCI's main funders and other other rental mouths in the city of Bissau. The MCCI, a militia designed by JBV and DSP, now funded and directed by "future triangle of power" ie "DSP, Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi", have 3 main objectives: 1st disrupting public order in the name of citizenship, defaming and trying to disbelief whatever organizations or individuals not aligned with the triangle in order to support their walks in the search for power. 2º If the objective of the triangle is realized, the role of the MCCI militia will become constant surveillance to all opponents to ensure false social peace and the power of control. 3º Try to gain credibility with international and regional organizations, through their visits and facade activities, so when there are such public order disturbance activities, they can gain notoriety. But this should not worry anyone, as they are well identified and well hunted, inside and outside Guinea-Bissau. I have nothing against anyone, but those who continue to disturb true social peace of the Guineans in exchange for benefits as always has been in the last years of this crisis, and that I have always tolerated, so that it is clear "I am firm and determined for everything and everyone." Finally, I would like to leave you a reflection with the following sentence: "Domingos Simões Pereira is a serious danger to the country's future." This is because publishing here everything that is necessary to prove or support the reason for this sentence, can only further aggravate the social peace we need so much. Enough, enough we can not continue to live in this turbulence all life, my Guinean brothers, is not healthy, it is toxic, not fair to a people who suffered so much.
